trans-unit.source: Structure that represents a rotation in three dimensions.
Quaternions allow you to interpolate between rotation transformations applied to an object, thereby making it easier to compute smooth animations of rotations.
A quaternion represents an axis of rotation and a rotation around that axis.

It's possible to individually define the axis and angle of rotation of the starting and ending positions of a rotated object ,but the intermediate positions of that object during an animation are computationally uncertain.
By determining a quaternion that represents the original orientation of a 3-D object and one that represents its destination orientation, you can smoothly interpolate between those orientations.
In XAML, the delimiter between the values of a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Quaternion> can be either a comma or a space.
Some cultures might use the comma character as the decimal delimiter instead of the period character.
XAML processing for invariant culture defaults to en-US in most XAML processor implementations, and expects the period to be the decimal delimiter.

You should avoid using the comma character as the decimal delimiter if specifying a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Quaternion> in XAML, because that will clash with the string type conversion of a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Quaternion> attribute value into its components.
XAML Attribute Usage
XAML Values
The <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Quaternion.X%2A> component of this <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Quaternion> structure.
The <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Quaternion.Y%2A> component of this <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Quaternion> structure.
The <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Quaternion.Z%2A> component of this <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Quaternion> structure.
The <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Quaternion.W%2A> component of this <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Quaternion> structure.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Quaternion"></xref> structure.
The <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Quaternion.W%2A> property of the quaternion is computed automatically.
<xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Vector3D"></xref> that represents the axis of rotation.
Angle to rotate around the specified axis, in degrees.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Quaternion"></xref> structure.
For the axis (x, y, z) and angle of rotation theta, the `w` value for the quaternion is:
w = cos(theta/2)
Note that if you use the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Vector3D> constructor, the fourth parameter is the angle, in degrees, and the w calculation is performed for you.
Value of the new <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Quaternion"></xref>'s X coordinate.
Value of the new <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Quaternion"></xref>'s Y coordinate.
Value of the new <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Quaternion"></xref>'s Z coordinate.
Value of the new <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Quaternion"></xref>'s W coordinate.
Adds the specified quaternions.
First quaternion to add.
Second quaternion to add.
Quaternion that is the result of addition.
Gets the quaternion's angle, in degrees.
Double that represents the quaternion's angle, in degrees.
Gets the quaternion's axis.
<xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Vector3D"></xref> that represents the quaternion's axis.
Replaces a quaternion with its conjugate.
Compares two <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Quaternion"></xref> instances for equality.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Quaternion> components are described using <xref:System.Double> values.
Because the value of a <xref:System.Double> can lose precision when operated upon, a comparison between two <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Quaternion> values that are logically equal might fail.
Object with which to compare.
`true` if the two <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Quaternion"></xref> instances are exactly equal, `false` otherwise.

`true` if the quaternion is the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Quaternion.Identity"></xref> quaternion, `false` otherwise.

A string representation of a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Quaternion"></xref>.
<xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Quaternion"></xref> represented by the string.
Interpolates between two orientations using spherical linear interpolation.
Spherical linear interpolation is useful for animating a three-dimensional models because it provides smooth transitions between different orientations of the model.
<xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Quaternion"></xref> that represents the starting orientation.
<xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Quaternion"></xref> that represents the ending orientation.
Interpolation coefficient.
<xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Quaternion"></xref> that represents the orientation resulting from the interpolation.
Interpolates between orientations, represented as <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Quaternion"></xref> structures, using spherical linear interpolation.
Spherical linear interpolation is useful for animating a three-dimensional models because it provides smooth transitions between different orientations of the model.
<xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Quaternion"></xref> that represents the starting orientation.
<xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Quaternion"></xref> that represents the ending orientation.
Interpolation coefficient.
Boolean that indicates whether to compute quaternions that constitute the shortest possible arc on a four-dimensional unit sphere.
<xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Quaternion"></xref> that represents the orientation resulting from the interpolation.

This member supports the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.IFormattable.ToString(System.String,System.IFormatProvider)"></xref>.
The string specifying the format to use.
-or-
`null` to use the default format defined for the type of the <xref href="System.IFormattable"></xref> implementation.
The `IFormatProvider` to use to format the value.
-or-
`null` to obtain the numeric format information from the current locale setting of the operating system.
A string containing the value of the current instance in the specified format.
